page.title: 16ROMAN VILLA _ CHIGNALS
page.content:
The Roman Villa at Chignal St.James was discovered in 1975. The outlines of ditches and banks can be seen from the air, and it was an aerial survey that found it. The villa can be found in Great Banks Field. There is an elaborate defensive bank built around the villa, this could possibly of post Roman origin. A great deal of pottery was discovered although no complete items. In lower excavations Iron age pottery was discovered . The date is thought to be shortly after the Roman conquest calculated from a bronze broach that was found.
**************************
